definition: camel/white horse with a black mane (archaic)
the straw that broke the camel’s back (idiom)/the final straw
pinyin: ya1 si3 luo4 tuo5 de5 zui4 hou4 yi1 gen1 dao4 cao3
containing_words.word: 压死骆驼的最后一根稻草

definition: xylitol (Cantonese)/see also 木糖醇[mu4 tang2 chun2]

lit. even a scrawny camel is bigger than a horse (idiom)/fig. even after suffering a loss, a rich person is still better off than ordinary people/a cultured person may come down in the world, but he is still superior to the common people
pinyin: shou4 si3 de5 luo4 tuo5 bi3 ma3 da4

definition: Camel Xiangzi, novel by Lao She 老舍

sentences.english: This study demonstrated A. pseudoalhagi extract has no significant side effects on rats.
sentences.chinese: 本研究证明骆驼刺提取物对大鼠无明显毒副作用。

sentences.english: The two-humped camel of central Asia was also domesticated long ago.
sentences.chinese: 中亚的双峰骆驼，很早以前就被驯化。

sentences.english: The camels in desert countries are for riding and for carrying goods.
sentences.chinese: 沙漠地区的骆驼供骑人和运货之用。

sentences.english: The camel is going to eat the flower on the girl's hat.
sentences.chinese: 骆驼将要吃女孩帽子上的那朵花。

sentences.english: John was clothed in camel's hair and wore a leather garment around his waist.
sentences.chinese: 若翰身穿骆驼毛外衣，腰间束著皮带。

sentences.english: Police then rushed to the scene to sort out the horse and Luo Tuoqing meeting place.
sentences.chinese: 警方随后赶赴现场将马和骆驼清理出集会场所。

sentences.english: The last straw breaks the camels back.
sentences.chinese: 最后一根稻草能垮骆驼的背。

sentences.english: What do camels do in desert?
Daniel, you are quite good at camel riding.
sentences.chinese: 大牛，你这骆驼骑得还挺好。

sentences.english: Camels are ships in the desert.
Camels were much better than horses for travelling a long distance.
sentences.chinese: 骆驼比马更适用于长途旅行。

sentences.english: Then Jacob rose up, and set his sons and his wives upon camels;
sentences.chinese: 雅各起来，使他的儿子和妻子都骑上骆驼。

sentences.english: Camels are represented in the New World by lamas.
sentences.chinese: 在新世界骆马相当于骆驼。

sentences.english: It is a wonderful experience to travel through the desert by camel.
sentences.chinese: 骑坐骆驼穿越沙漠旅行是一次了不起的体验。

sentences.english: The llama was domesticated long ago as a beast of burden.
sentences.chinese: 很早以前，美洲骆驼就被驯服为役兽。

sentences.english: A giraffe can go without water longer than a camel can.
sentences.chinese: 长颈鹿比骆驼能忍受更长时间不喝水。

definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
